text:
-Back on wiretapping,
Comey said he

has no information supporting
that President Obama
wiretapped President Trump.

So with that, you
have Schiff saying

like there are
half truths coming
from this president, no truth.
It's dangerous.
We are alienating allies.

We need to be able to
trust our president.

And with that, I'm
going to ask you,

and I need an
answer for this, how

do you gain trust as some view
of as the boy who cried wolf?

SEAN SPICER: I think
if you're citing

Adam Schiff's political
diatribe at the beginning
as some sort of sense of--
I mean, he literally went off--

you want to talk about--
hold on. hold on.

You want to talk about
a series of myths,
truths, and misdirection.

I think if you look at
that opening statement,
it was filled with those.

So I don't need to
use that as some basis
for having to respond to you.

I was watching a lot of the
reporter response on Twitter

initially to his
sort of diatribe.

And I think there were
several folks that

talked about how he's
mischaracterizing and taking
things way out of context.

So to use that as the basis of
some kind of authoritative--

-Well, what about Comey saying
there is no information.
And how do we gain the trust?

SEAN SPICER: I think
at this point--

and again, I think, April, I've
addressed this multiple times.
At this point, there is--

we are at the beginning
phases of this.
And we have a ways to go.
